metadata.title: CVE-2013-5892 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in the Oracle VM VirtualBox component in OracleVirtualization VirtualBox prior to 3.2.20, 4.0.22, 4.1.30, 4.2.22, and4.3.6 allows local users to affect confidentiality, integrity, andavailability via unknown vectors related to Core.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-5892` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

virtualbox - 4.3.10-dfsg-1
virtualbox-dkms - 4.3.10-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-dkms - 4.3.10-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-source - 4.3.10-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-utils - 4.3.10-dfsg-1
virtualbox-guest-x11 - 4.3.10-dfsg-1
virtualbox-qt - 4.3.10-dfsg-1
virtualbox-source - 4.3.10-dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: virtualbox package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.3.10-dfsg-1').
